author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Please stop the merge of this package. There is currently a discussion going on at [discourse](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/tabulations-jl-function-tabulation-made-easy/72653/2) and several people think that this package could use a better, more esplicative name. Once we've found such a name, I'll send another pull request. Thank you!
Ok, it is up to you.

body:
- Registering package: Tabulations

- Description: A package to create and load tabulations of functions. Supports Unitful.
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
> Initial release of Tabulations.jl, a package to create and load tabulations of functions which supports Unitful.
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->
title: New package: Tabulations v0.1.0
